00059 #define CMD_CHIP_ERASE        (SPIFlash[sSPI_FLASH_Index].Cmd.ChipErase)
00060 #define CMD_SECTOR_ERASE      (SPIFlash[sSPI_FLASH_Index].Cmd.SectorErase)
00061 #define CMD_WRITE             (SPIFlash[sSPI_FLASH_Index].Cmd.Write)
00062 #define CMD_READ              (SPIFlash[sSPI_FLASH_Index].Cmd.Read)
00063 #define CMD_DUALREAD          (SPIFlash[sSPI_FLASH_Index].Cmd.DualRead)
00064 #define CMD_WRITE_STATUS      (SPIFlash[sSPI_FLASH_Index].Cmd.WriteStatus)
00065 #define CMD_REAFD_STATUS      (SPIFlash[sSPI_FLASH_Index].Cmd.ReadStatus)
00066 #define CMD_WRITE_ENABLE      (SPIFlash[sSPI_FLASH_Index].Cmd.WriteEnable)
00067 #define CMD_WRITE_DISABLE     (SPIFlash[sSPI_FLASH_Index].Cmd.WriteDisable)

00133 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00134 /** @defgroup SPI_FLASH_AUTO_Exported_Functions SPI_FLASH_AUTO exported functions
00135   * @{
00136   */
00137 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00138   * @brief  Reads JEDEC ID.
00139   * @retval JEDEC ID value.
00140   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00141 u32 SPI_FLASH_ReadJEDECID_0(void)
00142 {
00143   u32 Temp = 0, Temp0 = 0, Temp1 = 0, Temp2 = 0;
00144 
00145   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00146   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00147 
00148   /* Send "JEDEC Read-ID" instruction                                                                       */
00149   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(SPI_FLASH_CMD_JEDECID_0);
00150 
00151   /* Read a byte from the FLASH                                                                             */
00152   Temp0 = SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00153 
00154   /* Read a byte from the FLASH                                                                             */
00155   Temp1 = SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00156 
00157   /* Read a byte from the FLASH                                                                             */
00158   Temp2 = SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00159 
00160   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00161   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00162 
00163   Temp = (Temp0 << 16) | (Temp1 << 8) | Temp2;
00164 
00165   return Temp;
00166 }
00167 
00168 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00169   * @brief  Erases the entire FLASH.
00170   * @retval None
00171   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00172 void SPI_FLASH_ChipErase_0(void)
00173 {
00174   /* Send write enable instruction                                                                          */
00175   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable_0();
00176 
00177   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00178   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00179   /* Send "Chip Erase" instruction                                                                          */
00180   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(CMD_CHIP_ERASE);
00181   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00182   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00183 
00184   /* Wait the write operation has completed                                                                 */
00185   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd_0();
00186 }
00187 
00188 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00189   * @brief  Erases the specified FLASH sector.
00190   * @param  SectorAddr: address of the sector to erase.
00191   * @retval None
00192   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00193 void SPI_FLASH_SectorErase_0(u32 SectorAddr)
00194 {
00195   /* Send write enable instruction                                                                          */
00196   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable_0();
00197 
00198   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00199   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00200   /* Send "Sector Erase" instruction                                                                        */
00201   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(CMD_SECTOR_ERASE);
00202   /* Send high byte address of SectorAddr                                                                   */
00203   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0((SectorAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00204   /* Send medium byte address of SectorAddr                                                                 */
00205   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0((SectorAddr & 0xFF00) >> 8);
00206   /* Send low byte address of SectorAddr                                                                    */
00207   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(SectorAddr & 0xFF);
00208   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00209   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00210 
00211   /* Wait the write operation has completed                                                                 */
00212   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd_0();
00213 }
00214 
00215 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00216   * @brief  Reads a block of data from the FLASH.
00217   * @param  ReadBuffer : pointer to the buffer that receives the data read from the FLASH.
00218   * @param  ReadAddr : FLASH's internal address to read from.
00219   * @param  NumOfReadByte : number of bytes to read from the FLASH.
00220   * @retval None
00221   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00222 void SPI_FLASH_BufferRead_0(u8* ReadBuffer, u32 ReadAddr, u32 NumOfReadByte)
00223 {
00224   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00225   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00226 
00227   /* Send "Read from Memory " instruction                                                                   */
00228   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(CMD_READ);
00229 
00230   /* Send high byte address of ReadAddr                                                                     */
00231   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0((ReadAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00232   /* Send medium byte address of ReadAddr                                                                   */
00233   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0((ReadAddr& 0xFF00) >> 8);
00234   /* Send low byte address of ReadAddr                                                                      */
00235   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(ReadAddr & 0xFF);
00236 
00237   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00238 
00239   while (NumOfReadByte--)
00240   {
00241     /* Read a byte from the FLASH                                                                           */
00242     *ReadBuffer = SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00243     /* Point to the next location where the byte read will be saved                                         */
00244     ReadBuffer++;
00245   }
00246 
00247   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00248   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00249 }
00250 
00251 #if (DUAL_READ_ENABLE == 1)
00252 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00253   * @brief  Reads a block of data from the FLASH using Dual Output Mode.
00254   * @param  ReadBuffer : pointer to the buffer that receives the data read from the FLASH.
00255   * @param  ReadAddr : FLASH's internal address to read from.
00256   * @param  NumOfReadByte : number of half words to read from the FLASH.
00257   * @retval None
00258   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00259 void SPI_FLASH_BufferDualRead_0(u16* ReadBuffer, u32 ReadAddr, u32 NumOfReadByte)
00260 {
00261   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00262   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00263 
00264   /* Send "Read from Memory " instruction                                                                   */
00265   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(CMD_DUALREAD);
00266   /* Send high byte address of ReadAddr                                                                     */
00267   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0((ReadAddr & 0xFF0000) >> 16);
00268   /* Send medium byte address of ReadAddr                                                                   */
00269   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0((ReadAddr& 0xFF00) >> 8);
00270   /* Send low byte address of ReadAddr                                                                      */
00271   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(ReadAddr & 0xFF);
00272 
00273   /* Enable Dual Port                                                                                       */
00274   SPI_DUALCmd(FLASH_SPI, ENABLE);
00275 
00276   /* Send dummy byte                                                                                        */
00277   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00278 
00279   while (NumOfReadByte--)
00280   {
00281     /* Read a byte from the FLASH                                                                           */
00282     *ReadBuffer = SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00283     /* Point to the next location where the byte read will be saved                                         */
00284     ReadBuffer++;
00285   }
00286 
00287   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00288   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00289 
00290   /* Disable Dual Port                                                                                      */
00291   SPI_DUALCmd(FLASH_SPI, DISABLE);
00292 }
00293 #endif
00294 
00295 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00296   * @brief  Writes the new value to the Status Register.
00297   * @param  Value : the new value to be written to the Status Register.
00298   * @retval None
00299   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00300 void SPI_FLASH_WriteStatus_0(u8 Value)
00301 {
00302   SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable_0();
00303 
00304   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00305   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00306 
00307   /* Send "Write Status Register" instruction                                                               */
00308   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(CMD_WRITE_STATUS);
00309   /* Writes to the Status Register                                                                          */
00310   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(Value);
00311 
00312   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00313   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00314 
00315   /* Wait the write operation has completed                                                                 */
00316   SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd_0();
00317 }
00318 
00319 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00320   * @brief  Enables the write access to the FLASH.
00321   * @retval None
00322   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00323 void SPI_FLASH_WriteEnable_0(void)
00324 {
00325   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00326   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00327 
00328   /* Send "Write Enable" instruction                                                                        */
00329   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(CMD_WRITE_ENABLE);
00330 
00331   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00332   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00333 }
00334 
00335 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00336   * @brief  Disables the write access to the FLASH.
00337   * @retval None
00338   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00339 void SPI_FLASH_WriteDisable_0(void)
00340 {
00341   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00342   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00343 
00344   /* Send "Write Disable" instruction                                                                       */
00345   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(CMD_WRITE_DISABLE);
00346 
00347   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00348   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00349 }
00350 
00351 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00352   * @brief  Polls the status of the BUSY flag in the FLASH's status register and waits for the end of Flash
00353             writing.
00354   * @retval None
00355   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00356 void SPI_FLASH_WaitForWriteEnd_0(void)
00357 {
00358   u8 FLASH_Status = 0;
00359 
00360   /* Select the SPI FLASH                                                                                   */
00361   SPI_FLASH_SEL_ACTIVE();
00362 
00363   /* Send "Read Status Register" instruction                                                                */
00364   SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(CMD_REAFD_STATUS);
00365 
00366   /* Loop as long as the busy flag is set                                                                   */
00367   do
00368   {
00369     /* Send a dummy byte to generate the clock to read the value of the status register                     */
00370     FLASH_Status = SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(SPI_FLASH_DUMMY_BYTE);
00371 
00372   } while ((FLASH_Status & SPI_FLASH_BUSY_FLAG) == SET);
00373 
00374   /* Deselect the SPI FLASH                                                                                 */
00375   SPI_FLASH_SEL_INACTIVE();
00376 }
00377 
00378 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00379   * @brief  Sends a byte through the SPI interface and return the byte received from the SPI bus.
00380   * @param  byte : byte to send.
00381   * @retval The value of the received byte.
00382   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00383 u16 SPI_FLASH_SendByte_0(u8 byte)
00384 {
00385   /* Loop while Tx buffer register is empty                                                                 */
00386   while (!SPI_GetFlagStatus(FLASH_SPI, SPI_FLAG_TXBE));
00387   //while ((FLASH_SPI->SR & SPI_FLAG_TXBE) == 0);
00388 
00389   /* Send byte through the SPIx peripheral                                                                  */
00390   SPI_SendData(FLASH_SPI, byte);
00391   //FLASH_SPI->DR = byte;
00392 
00393   /* Loop while Rx is not empty                                                                             */
00394   while (!SPI_GetFlagStatus(FLASH_SPI, SPI_FLAG_RXBNE));
00395   //while ((FLASH_SPI->SR & SPI_FLAG_RXBNE) == 0);
00396 
00397   /* Return the byte read from the SPI                                                                      */
00398   return SPI_ReceiveData(FLASH_SPI);
00399   //return (u16)(FLASH_SPI->DR);
00400 }
